definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: The survival and growth of this magazine depends on a steady, reliable income from advertisers.
sentences.chinese: 这本杂志的存续和成长全赖于稳定可靠的广告收入。

sentences.english: Several studies have linked grandmothers, in particular, with survival of the species.
sentences.chinese: 特别是某些有关物种存续的研究和祖母相关。

sentences.english: That opened up in public the possibility that the currency union might not be forever.
sentences.chinese: 此举将欧元区不会永远存续的可能性公开化了。

sentences.english: Remember, this site will probably have a short shelf life.
sentences.chinese: 请记住，此站点可能只有很短的存续期。

sentences.english: Splitting may take the forms of split-off and split-up.
sentences.chinese: 公司分立可以采取存续分立和解散分立两种形式。

definition: to maintain/to keep up/to hold together
to keep/to preserve/extant/to remain (from the past)
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
